info.name: Facial nerve, intermediate root
info.description: The facial cranial nerve consists of a large motor root and a smaller, intermediate root that consists of the sensory fibers (SVA for taste; GVA for general sensation) plus the parasympathetic fibers that serve the lacrimal glands, submandibular and sublingual salivary glands.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/3 Cranial nerves of Pons & Medulla
